page.title: 07Shops in Coddenham Area
page.content: There is a good old-fashioned butcher shop in Coddenham with adjacent slaughterhouse. Homemade sausages are the speciality of the butcher and deliveries are made far afield by van. The Post Office is housed in a lovely timber-framed building and also sells stationery, wool and gifts. An antique shop has recently opened next to the village store and is a futher attraction for visitors to the area. A small craft shop in Coddenham High St sells high quality hand crafted goods. The Public House in Coddenham called the Dukes Head was for many years the favourite hostelry of a famous cartoonist. The Public House near Hemingstone is called the Cross Keys. Milk is delivered daily, mobile grocery and fish van and a bakery van call regularly. A shop at Hemingstone Fruit Farm sells fruit and vegetables.
